Module External::Chunkable
In: lib/external/chunkable.rb

The Chunkable mixin provides methods for organizing a span or range into chunks no larger than a specified block size.

Methods

chunk   default_span   range_begin_and_end   reverse_chunk   split_range   split_span  

Attributes

default_blksize  [RW] 
length  [RW] 

Public Instance methods

chunk(range_or_span=default_span, blksize=default_blksize) {|rbegin, blksize| ...}

Breaks the input range or span into chunks of blksize or less. The offset and length of each chunk will be provided to the block, if given. 

  blksize           # => 100
  chunk(0..250)     # => [[0,100],[100,100],[200,50]]

  results = []
  chunk([10,190]) {|offset, length| results << [offset, length]}
  results           # => [[10,100],[110,90]]
default_span()

Returns the default span: [0, length]

reverse_chunk(range_or_span=default_span, blksize=default_blksize) {|rend, blksize| ...}

Breaks the input range or span into chunks of blksize or less, beginning from the end of the interval. The offset and length of each chunk will be provided to the block, if given. 

  blksize                   # => 100
  reverse_chunk(0..250)     # => [[150,100],[50,100],[0,50]]

  results = []
  reverse_chunk([10,190]) {|offset, length| results << [offset, length]}
  results                   # => [[100,100],[10,90]]

Protected Instance methods

range_begin_and_end(range_or_span)
split_range(range)

Converts a range into an offset and length. Negative values are counted back from self.length 

  length                # => 10
  split_range(0..9)     # => [0,10]
  split_range(0...9)    # => [0,9]

  split_range(-1..9)    # => [9,1]
  split_range(0..-1)    # => [0,10]
split_span(span)
